intro: Pentacalia calyculata, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are evergreen, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
